project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 10 September 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#deebff}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for your feedback on the ticket and supporting our team in our investigation!

After analysing the problem, we have identified the issue of "Poor performance with high CPU and a high number of SdOffThreadEventJobRunner threads" has been fixed in [JSD 4.4.0|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagement/jira-service-desk-4-4-x-release-notes-974369354.html]. This problem occurred due to the unbounded nature of threads before 4.4.0, which resulted in a high DB load on the instance.

However - we have identified two other issues with the JSM async processing logic which we need to resolve, related to the problems reported in this bug ticket. These issues are tracked in their respective tickets -

1. JSDSERVER-5730
 - This is related to deadlocking of threads when there are frequent actions on one request. A fix for this is released behind a dark feature in 4.9.0
 - The development team will be working on enabling this by default in future. More details on the fix -
 [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/deadlocking-in-jira-service-desk-when-frequently-updating-the-same-issue-979428323.html]

2. JSDSERVER-8635
 - This is related to threads deadlocking when processing for one issue takes over 5 minutes. This ticket is currently gathering impact.

Please let us know if you have any further concerns with the above, please open a support ticket via [https://support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com/]

Thank you,

Alex
{panel}
h1. Description 

JSD 3.9.0 attempts to address some of the friction between the SLA system and automation (JSDSERVER-4743) and poor issue creation performance by introducing a wrapper event type (inspired by [OnCommitEvent|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/7.6.0/com/atlassian/jira/event/commit/OnCommitEvent.html]) and an “expectation” system.

The expectation system gives features that are interested in one or more eligible event types a way to explicitly define the work that should be done _before_ a wrapped event is dispatched, by submitting “jobs” that are executed in the strict cluster-wide order of their submission (no more than one job at a time for each issue) using a thread pool to avoid blocking any request threads (though we just use the submitting thread if it’s not a request thread).

The wrapper event type does the same for the work that should be done _after_ what we refer to as “completion”, by defining [@EventListener|https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-event/3.1.3/apidocs/com/atlassian/event/api/EventListener.html] methods of type {{public void(ServiceDeskWrappedOnCompletionEvent)}}.

At least two recent support cases have involved severe performance degradation of a node in and/or the database for an instance that seems to have been caused or exacerbated by the expectation system, so we’ll link potential causes to this issue as we find them.
h1. Diagnosis
 * High CPU usage on DB server
 * Increased number of threads used by the Jira process
 * High number of SdOffThreadEventJobRunner threads on thread dumps connecting to the database

h1. Possible workaround (JSD 3.9+)

These steps affect the expectation system such that jobs are always executed immediately on the submitting thread, without touching any OffThreadEventJobRunner or PSMQ code paths, as if the submitting threads are never request threads (JSDSERVER-5730).
 # Go to the dark feature settings page ({{<baseURL>/secure/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa}})
 # Remove the feature flag {{sd.internal.base.off.thread.on.completion.events.enabled}}, if it exists
 # Add the following feature flag: {{sd.internal.base.off.thread.on.completion.events.disabled}}
 # Restart JIRA

SLA accuracy shouldn’t be negatively affected, but issue creation might take longer as a result. WHEN issue created automation rules with SLA-related JQL should still work (JSDSERVER-4743).
fields.summary: Poor performance with high CPU and a high number of SdOffThreadEventJobRunner threads

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Automation Rules in JIRA Service Desk will not execute when triggered by comments added by JIRA Incoming Mail handler and when the rules are configured to run “Run as the user who triggered the rule”

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1) Deploy JIRA Service Desk + JIRA Software test instance

2) Create a test Service Desk Project

3) Configure JIRA Incoming mail handler (Jira->System->Incoming Mail) and point it to the Project created at Step1 above

4) In the test JIRA Service Desk Project create a very simple Automation Rule: Transition issue on Comment (In my case the rule is "Issue is Commented" -> Comment is internal -> Transition issue. Ensure the rule is configured to "Run as the user who triggered the rule" 

5) Assign the required permissions for Customers to be able to comment on tickets - most importantly "Add comments" permissions to the Reporter

6) Create a customer in Service Desk; Login with that Customer via the Service Desk Portal and log a new issue;

7) Send an email from that customer to that issue. Verify that the comment gets added to the issue;

8) Check Automation Rules Log – there's nothing in the log to indicate that there was any attempt to even run the rule

h3. Expected Results

Automation rules should execute

h5. Actual Results

Automation rules will not execute

h5. Workaround

Option 1: Configure the rules to run as "Run as project default (JIRA Admin)"
Option 2: Use JIRA Service Desk Email Channel
fields.summary: Automation Rules in JIRA Service Desk will not execute when triggered by comments added by JIRA Incoming Mail handler and when the rules are configured to run “Run as the user who triggered the rule”

fields.description:
h3. Description

Currently, Customers in Service Desk cannot access any issues within JIRA - even if they are public to anonymous users.

*Steps to Reproduce*

* Create a Service Desk project 
* Configure the Browse Projects permission to {{Anyone}}
* Log in with a Customer on the Service Desk portal
* Attempt to access the URL of a public JIRA issue, for example: {{http://localhost:8080/browse/AD-2}}
* You will be redirected to the Service Desk portal page

Since this issue is public, it would make sense that customers can also see them.

h3. Work around

Log out of the Service Desk portal. You will be able to see the issue then.
fields.summary: Allow customers to see public issues on JIRA

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
OffThreadEventJobRunner#startup() calls [Executors#newCachedThreadPool(ThreadFactory)|https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/util/concurrent/Executors.html#newCachedThreadPool-java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory-], which [constructs a ThreadPoolExecutor|https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/util/concurrent/ThreadPoolExecutor.html#ThreadPoolExecutor-int-int-long-java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit-java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue-java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory-] with a {{maximumPoolSize}} of {{Integer.MAX_VALUE}}. Each job execution thread consumes a connection from the DBCP most of the time it’s alive, so an unbounded number of these threads that grows too large can exhaust the DBCP.

h/t [~dwlizlo]
fields.summary: OffThreadEventJobRunner uses an unbounded ThreadPoolExecutor that can exhaust the DBCP

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 10 September 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#deebff}
Hi everyone,

We have reopened this bug after investigation of a related issue documented in JSDSERVER-5736
 - This is related to deadlocking of threads when there are frequent actions on one request. A workaround for this was released behind a dark feature in 4.9.0
 - The development team will be working on a permanent fix shortly.

For details on the workaround please see the related documentation - 
 * [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/deadlocking-in-jira-service-desk-when-frequently-updating-the-same-issue-979428323.html]

We hope to resolve this issue as soon as possible!

If you have further concerns with the above, please open a support ticket via [https://support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com/]

Thank you,

Alex
{panel}
 

The expectation system executes each job on the node that submitted it. When the submitting thread is a request thread, the system generates a unique identifier for each submission, enqueues it on a PSMQ for the issue to which the given event pertains, then the OffThreadEventJobRunner uses an unbounded ThreadPoolExecutor (JSDSERVER-5732) to spawn a thread that’s equipped with that unique identifier.

Each job execution thread locks the queue on which it expects to see its unique identifier (UPDATE QUEUE), locks the message at the head of the queue expecting that the message contains its unique identifier (BEGIN + UPDATE QUEUE + SELECT MESSAGE + UPDATE MESSAGE + UPDATE QUEUE + COMMIT), dequeues the message (BEGIN + UPDATE QUEUE + DELETE MESSAGE + UPDATE QUEUE + COMMIT), and finally executes the associated work.

There are many points at which this process can fail under contention. While most of the failure modes that PSMQ handles with immediate retries up to 10000 ms should be unlikely (fewer messages than readers; next message has expired; message dequeued by other reader between peek and dequeue), there are at least two failure modes that we handle by repeating the process after sleeping for 5 ms (queue locked by other reader; next message doesn’t contain thread’s unique identifier).

This approach is obviously inefficient, but I can see how it might be an appropriate choice under an assumption like “contention for a given queue should only occur rarely and randomly”. That assumption, at the very least, doesn’t seem to hold, given the reports that some bulk issue operation and ScriptRunner usage patterns can easily result in contention, and evidence from our initial investigation that actions as simple as posting a comment almost always result in contention.

In the case of posting a comment, the contention occurs because our EventListenerLauncher appears to submit one SLA cycle updater job for [each of the two commit-wrapped events|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/SDSERVER/repos/servicedesk/browse/plugin/src/main/java/com/atlassian/servicedesk/bootstrap/listener/EventListenerLauncher.java?at=refs%2Ftags%2F3.9.0-REL-0001#155,157,168,170,331,345,371,377] that are [dispatched by JIRA|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/JIRASERVER/repos/jira/browse/jira-components/jira-core/src/main/java/com/atlassian/jira/event/issue/IssueEventBundleFactoryImpl.java?at=refs%2Ftags%2F7.6.0#115]. The usual outcome is that we spawn two job execution threads in quick succession that contend for the same queue, and one of the threads issues at least ten unsuccessful UPDATE QUEUE queries under ideal conditions (no other activity, local database, empty instance, task management project, and the thread for the first job wins the race).
fields.summary: OffThreadEventJobRunner job execution threads wait for their turn in a very expensive way

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When a customer is using the Service Desk Mail Handler to create issues by emails and receives hundreds of emails per day, it is very difficult to find in the process logs (in ⚙ > Applications > Service Desk Email > View logs) which emails failed to be process. The customer has to scroll down for hours until they find the emails that failed.

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be very convenient to add a filter to the process logs to only display the emails that failed (or succeeded) to be processed to help the customer find such emails faster.

h3. Workaround 

No workaround.
fields.summary: Add the possibility to filter the Mail Handler Process Logs to only show the mails that failed to be processed

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
When accessing KB article from JIRA service desk via a mobile device, the error is receiving 403 error at their end.

h3. *Environment*
* IOS mobile Device (IPhone or IPAD)
* Android Mobile Device
* JIRA Service Desk 3.11.1

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
# Setup unlicensed knowledge base access in JIRA service desk
# Access JIRA service desk via mobile (Andriod/IOS)
# Search for any KB article and click to view the article.
# Enter confluence login credential to access the KB article

h3. *Expected Results*
The kb article will be loaded without any issue.

h3. *Actual Results*
The user is presented with error 403 as shown below:
 !Error 403.JPG|thumbnail! 

h3. *Notes*
* This behavior only happens when the unlicensed access permission is given to the KB article.
* If the confluence page is granted with anonymous access or if the user who is accessing the KB article from service desk have confluence license the page loads fine without the 403 error.

*Working Url for mobile access*: http://10.60.2.214:8090/conf680/plugins/servlet/mobile?contentId=65605#content/view/65605 (with anonymous or licensed access)
*Non-Working Url from mobile access*: http://10.60.2.214:8090/conf680/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=65605 (with unlicensed access)

h3.*Workaround*
-Once the user login to confluence via service desk though the error is prompt the session is captured in a mobile browser, hence browsing the same article again will work fine until the session is cleared from the browser.-
None
fields.summary: Accessing Knowledge Base Article From Jira Service Desk On Mobile Throws 403 Warning

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Issues created from emails attach files such as marketing advertisment images or even text often included in singatures to an issue, which can clutter things for issue asignees in that they might not be able to filter out important attachments or will lose valuable time in manually deleting attached duplicate files from attachments. Additionally, administrators may want to restrict certain files from a source from being attached to new and existing issues.
h3. Suggested Solution

Implement a file and text filter on a global (JIRA administrators) and/or project (Project administrators) levels to exclude selected attachments or text from email content for new issues as well as comments added to existing.

In orde to manage files exclusions, there would be a select drop-down options next to each attached file allowing to quickly exclude attached files from further inclusions using a combination its name and checksum for uniqueness.

Select drop-down example options:
 * 'Exclude' => keeps the original file but prevents further duplicate copies
 * 'Remove and exclude' => removes original file and prevents further duplicate copies

A dedicated filters manager would then allow system admins or project managers to manage such exclusions (similar to lists for blocked users in IMs).
h3. Why this is important

Issues with multiple copies of attached files not pertinent to request's problem not only clutter the system but also can cause delays in ticket processing or ticket asignee to miss important attachments in growing list of duplicated files.

 

!Screen Shot 2018-03-21 at 21.01.26.png!
fields.summary: Ignore unwanted images in attachments for issues created from emails

fields.description:
There is a misleading information in the documentation:

 

E.g. https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver0310/configuring-the-customer-portal-945108846.html

{quote}

Follow the link (or select > Applications > JIRA Service Desk Configuration) to brand your customer portal header in a live preview mode. The header and branding *changes made here apply to all service desk project portals* and the global help center:

{quote}

_*Bold* being the point of interest_

This to me states, the announcement I put on the help center, for example, if there will be a downtime, will be shown inside each project's portal so that the customers are able to see it.

 

However, this is simply not true. I am not able to see the announcement in any project other than the help center. To further inform JSD customers via an announcement, I need to modify each project's portal individually.

 

This may be troublesome as it may create misunderstandings or not inform the user base altogether if one does not realize the broadcast is \*just\* not there.
fields.summary: Clarify documentation on Help Center Announcements

h3. Summary
Field is attached to a request type without being on the Create Issue screen.  Our documentation states that a field has to be on the screen to add new fields to the request type but there is no mention of existing fields in Request types. This can be confusing since it was there for one request type but not for others of the same type.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk using IT Service Desk as the template
# View the Request Type for Onboard new employees - the Due Date field appears
# Create a new Request type using the Service Request Issue type (same as previous)
# Edit fields to add Due Date

h3. Expected Results
Since Due Date is available for the Issue Type, it should be available for the new Request type.

h3. Actual Results
The field is not addable until it is added to the Issue Type Create Screen.
fields.summary: Request Type Fields can be removed from the issue screens but are still available in existing Request types

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
On behalf of one of our project:

 

When adding a user via "Add user to a role", in project-administration, currently, there is no clear indication whether you are adding a JSW user or a JSD one - that is, no information or warning shows up what user "type" is being added (whether they are JSW or JSD licensed).

This may cause some confusion as it may lead project administrators to believe they have added a new agent, while actually they have added a Collaborator with limited permissions.
h2. How project members are currently managed:
 * Use "Invite team" feature to add Agents

_For standard users (not jira-administrators), this only accepts JSD-licensed users_

_For administrators users (jira-administrators), the form informs them that the user is going to be included in JSD license user count_
 * Use "Add users to a role" to add Collaborators to the project

 
h2. Suggestion:

 - While adding a user via "Add users to a role", include a pop-up to inform the user if they are adding a non-jsd user (Collaborator); and/or separate the "Service Desk Team" into 2 different roles - Agents & Collaborators

(can be done by each Jira admin on their instance manually - but to make this more "official")

 - Improve the "Invite team" functionality to support adding both "types" - Agents & Collaborators, separately (to avoid mix-ups)

 - Allow non-jsd users to be selected in the "Invite team" form for Agents, but make it clear that the user requires a jsd license and that they need to reach out to their Jira administrator
fields.summary: Improve Project Roles view to better differentiate between Agents and Collaborators

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The {{com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.sla.audit.SlaAuditLogCleanupJobScheduler}} job was added as part of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-5266 to clean up the data of tables {{AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOGDATA}} and {{AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG}} as these tables can grow massive in size.
However, this job does a query like this : 
{code}select `AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG`.`ID`, `AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG`.`ISSUE_ID`, `AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG`.`SLA_ID` from `AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG` `AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG` where `AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG`.`ISSUE_ID` is null and `AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG`.`EVENT_TIME` < 1517364000008 or `AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG`.`ISSUE_ID` in (select `AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG`.`ISSUE_ID` from `AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG` `AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG` where `AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG`.`ISSUE_ID` is not null group by `AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG`.`ISSUE_ID` having max(`AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG`.`EVENT_TIME`) < 1517364000008);{code}
This query runs for several hours in the database.

h3. Environment
In this example instance that I analysed the tables have the following number of rows : 
*AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG* : 217.266
*AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOGDATA* : 517.309

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Let the job {{com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.sla.audit.SlaAuditLogCleanupJobScheduler}} run on the instance.

h3. Expected Results
The job finishes in reasonable time.

h3. Actual Results
The job can take up to 10+ hours to finish.
{code}# Query_time: 37781.640747  Lock_time: 0.000276 Rows_sent: 2501  Rows_examined: 45262655244
use jira;
SET timestamp=1519993781;
select `AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG`.`ID`, `AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG`.`ISSUE_ID`, `AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG`.`SLA_ID` from `AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG` `AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG` where `AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG`.`ISSUE_ID` is null and `AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG`.`EVENT_TIME` < 1517364000008 or `AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG`.`ISSUE_ID` in (select `AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG`.`ISSUE_ID` from `AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG` `AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG` where `AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG`.`ISSUE_ID` is not null group by `AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG`.`ISSUE_ID` having max(`AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG`.`EVENT_TIME`) < 1517364000008);{code}
 
h3. Workaround
* We can try to make the tables lighter manually. That should help with the audit job finishing in reasonable time.
If you *do not* use the SLA Audit log feature, you may delete all rows from these tables {{AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOGDATA}} and {{AO_54307E_SLAAUDITLOG}}.
* We can also make the SLA audit data get cleaned out sooner, preventing it from getting big enough to be problematic by applying the workaround in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-5871
fields.summary: com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.sla.audit.SlaAuditLogCleanupJobScheduler job running for several hours

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When creating an automation rule that sends emails and has multiple if statements, the last saved then action is written to all previous then actions for the rule.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a Custom Automation Rule
# Set When to (Issue Created) - any When will do
# Set If to Issue Matches Request Type - any if type will do
# Set Then to Send Email, To: Customers Involved and the content to Red
# Select the Plus sign to add a new Rule, the old rule is copied
# Update the then action content to Blue
# optional, edit the if matching rule

h3. Expected Results
The first If Then Action Content shows Red and the Else If Thewn Action Content shows Blue

h3. Actual Results
The first If Then Action Content shows Blue and the Else If Then Action Content shows Blue
 
h3. Notes
This same behaviour for Webhook works as intended

h3.Workaround
instead of editing the Then Action, Delete the newly added one and add a new action
fields.summary: Upon saving "Send email" automation rule, all previous then actions for previous else if's are overwritten with most recent added content for the rule

fields.description: We have built out our IT service desk using proper technical terms for networking and other support requests.  The problem is that many of our customers don't know the correct terms for what they are searching for or use different terms for the same thing.  I would love to see an option to add keywords to a request type that don't show up on the request itself, but are used for search.  For example, if someone is trying to request that a network jack be activated, our request type is called data jack activation.  I want to add keywords such as network, RJ45, and internet to the request type so that if those words are searched for, that this is one of the request types that will show up on the list.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Workaround}
Note that multiple projects could be affected by this issue, so you might have to apply the same workaround to multiple projects:

Ensure to make a backup of DB before making any changes to it.
 Shutdown JIRA.
 Run the following query in the database to determine if there is any duplicate rows corresponding to the warning message:
{code}
 select * from "AO_54307E_CAPABILITY" where "CAPABILITY_NAME" like 'CUSTOMER_INVITE_EMAIL_SUPPRESSED%'; 
{code}
Let's assume that you got duplicate rows for a given pservice desk ID, as shown in the screenshot below (in this case, the project ID is 1):
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-16 at 14.30.26.png|width=788,height=138! 
 The resolution consists in removing all the duplicate rows with the highest ID. In the example below, there are 2 duplicate rows for the service desk id 1 with the IDs 52 and 53, so the 2 rows below need to be deleted. If you see duplicate rows for other projects, please delete them as well. Note that the query below only applies to the example provided above. The IDs will likely be different in your instance.
{code:java}
 delete from "AO_54307E_CAPABILITY" where "ID" = '52'
 delete from "AO_54307E_CAPABILITY" where "ID" = '53' 
{code}
Start up JIRA and verify.

fields.description:
I was recently faced with the need to add Request Participants automatically on Service Desk request creation. 

I found this page:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-automatically-add-request-participants-when-creating-an-issue-777026955.html\\ 
I attempted the solution with ScriptRunner but ran into difficulties because of changes in the Jira 7.1 API which had removed IssueIndexManager. 

After experimenting, I found another solution that you might consider adding to the page. 

Using the Jira Misc Workflow Extensions add-on, I followed this process:

1. add a post-function to the Create Issue transition, and choose the "Set field value (JMWE add-on)" post-function

2. configure the post-function as follows:

To add individual users:

Field: Request participants
Value type: Raw value
Value: comma separated list of usernames

To add members of a group:

Field: Request participants
Value type: Groovy expression
Value: 
import com.atlassian.jira.component.ComponentAccessor
def groupManager = ComponentAccessor.getGroupManager()
groupManager.getUsersInGroup("groupname")

3. If necessary, add a script to Conditional Execution to verify that Request Participants are added only on the desired request type

import com.atlassian.jira.component.ComponentAccessor

def cf = ComponentAccessor.customFieldManager.getCustomFieldObjectByName("Customer Request Type")
def requestType = issue.getCustomFieldValue(cf)

if(requestType.toString() == "support/3c1462fe-0d70-4242-9d06-7d39e12e8f70")
{return true}
else
{return false}

This makes it very easy to add Request Participants automatically on request creation.
fields.summary: I attempted the solution with ScriptRunner but ran into difficulties because of changes in the Jira 7.1 API which had removed IssueIndexManager.

For users with concerns with accessibility, the incorrect queries show empty results, which is misleading because of the presence of exceptions. Here's the specific part of the page:

"Section 1194.31 Functional Performance Criteria – Detail

Criteria

Supporting Features

Remarks and explanations

(a) At least one mode of operation and information retrieval that does not require user vision shall be provided, or support for Assistive Technology used by people who are blind or visually impaired shall be provided.

Supports with exceptions

<[https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/issues/?jql=project%20%3D%20%22ACCESS%22%20AND%20labels%20%3D%20%22access-508-1194.21(a)%22%20and%20labels%20%3D%20access-service-desk%20AND%20resolution%20is%20EMPTY%20ORDER%20BY%20createdDate%20ASC]> View exceptions

(b) At least one mode of operation and information retrieval that does not require visual acuity greater than 20/70 shall be provided in audio and enlarged print output working together or independently, or support for Assistive Technology used by people who are visually impaired shall be provided.

Supports with exceptions

<[https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/issues/?jql=project%20%3D%20%22ACCESS%22%20AND%20labels%20%3D%20%22access-508-1194.21(b)%22%20and%20labels%20%3D%20access-service-desk%20AND%20resolution%20is%20EMPTY%20ORDER%20BY%20createdDate%20ASC]> View exceptions"

fields.description:
h3. +Summary+

Currently, if an SD Agent plays one of the following roles in an SD ticket:
 # Reporter - confirmed (/)
 # Request Participant - confirmed (/)
 # Approver - fixed in JSD 4.7.0 (!)
 # Customer Organization member - fixed in JSD 4.7.0 (!) 

_THEN_ he/she is treated as a Customer, not an Agent.

(flag) This doesn't affect the Agent's permissions and abilities to work on the ticket, however causes a few SD specific features not to work as expected by the SD Admins, including SLAs and Automations. For example:
 # SLA - *Comment: For Customers* doesn't work when the Agent adds a comment for the customers, because he/she's treated as a customer him/herself (which means the comment is deemed By Customers instead).
 # Automation - *If: User is not a customer* doesn't work in a similar way because the Agent is treated as a customer.

h3. +Known Issues+
 * When agent comment at issue created by himself , SLA didn't stop as per configured in "Time to Resolution"
 * Automation does not trigger when agent is listed in Request Participant
 * SLA does not pauses when commenting on the issue as participant
 * The condition "Comment:For Customers" in an SLA configuration is not verified when an agent is part of the same organization as the customer
*  The Agent is not considered as a Customer even if he is part of the Organisation. This makes the Automation condition 'User is a Customer' to fail and thus by not executing it.

h3. +Suggestion+

Allow JIRA Admins to decide when an agent should be treated as a customer. This should be configurable at the following levels:
 * System Level - applicable to all projects and issue types
 * Project & Issue Type Level - applicable to specific issue types in specific projects
 * User Preference Level - allow individual users to decide themselves
fields.summary: Allow JIRA Service Desk Admins to Decide When Agents should be Treated as Customers

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, for a customer to share an existing request with a customer who doesn't have an account yet, the following configuration is required in the Customer Permission setting page:

*Who can raise requests?* -> Anyone can email the service desk or raise a request in the portal
*Who can customers share requests with?* -> Any customer, by typing an email address

 !Screen Shot 2018-03-13 at 10.06.18 AM.png|thumbnail! 

The problem with this configuration is that it allows anyone to sign up on the customer portal. Basically, it is not possible to allow a customer to share a request with a non-existing customer, while disabling public sign up in the customer portal


h3. Suggested Solution

Introduce a new setting that allows the 2 following behaviors together:
- a customer can share a request with a non-existing customer, and a account is created for the customer the request is shared with
- public sign up is disabled on the customer portal (customers should be only created by agents, or by sharing requests with other customers)

 
h3. Workaround 

No workaround.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While loading CustomFields values for _SLA_ fields {{getValueFromIssue()}} method  flushes _EagerLoadingOfBizCustomFieldPersister_ cache (it's used by whole Jira) for each SLA cache miss.
Taking into account JSDSERVER-5681, that makes non-SD issues reindex also slow, since we do extra SQL calls.

h3. Environment
* Jira Core
* Jira ServiceDesk
* Some number (50+) of Service Desk SLA CF
* Large number (200+) of non Service Desk CF 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable SQL logging and set {{com.atlassian.servicedesk.cache.sla.value}} to DEBUG 
# Create non Service Desk issue 
# Check logs 

h3. Expected Results
While loading CustomFields values _EagerLoadingOfBizCustomFieldPersister_ is not flushed. 

h3. Actual Results
* you can see that during creating new KAN-8 (non-SD) issue, it's loading SLA value and also data from DB 
{noformat}
2018-03-08 17:15:36,645 http-nio-1762-exec-8 DEBUG admin 1035x464x1 hckbm2 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/QuickCreateIssue.jspa [c.a.s.cache.sla.value] For custom field id 'customfield_10423' for issue 'KAN-8' returning SLA value: null
...
2018-03-08 17:15:36,667 http-nio-1762-exec-8 DEBUG admin 1035x464x1 hckbm2 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/QuickCreateIssue.jspa [c.a.s.cache.sla.value] For custom field id 'customfield_10422' for issue 'KAN-8' returning SLA value: null
{noformat}
* Issue reindex time increases 
* Large number of SQL request to DB

h3. Notes
* {{loadSLAValue()}} method flushes *EagerLoadingOfBizCustomFieldPersister* cache and then load all CF values from DB, example SQL:
{code:SQL|borderStyle=solid}
SELECT ID, ISSUE, CUSTOMFIELD, UPDATED, PARENTKEY, STRINGVALUE, NUMBERVALUE, TEXTVALUE, DATEVALUE, VALUETYPE FROM customfieldvalue WHERE ISSUE='1319406' ORDER BY UPDATED ASC, ID ASC
{code}
** That means that potentially method do extra DB call for each SLA field, making reindexing slow.
* Taking into account JSDSERVER-5681, that makes non-SD issues reindex also slow, since we do extra SQL calls (~ SLA CF) 
* So problem is multiplication of _NumberOfIssues_ * _NumberOfSLA_ * _CostOfSQL_

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: While loading values for SLA CustomField getValueFromIssue method  flushes EagerLoadingOfBizCustomFieldPersister cache

fields.description:
h3. Summary
During issue reindexing Jira loads all related CustomField (CF). When you have ServiceDesk installed, its CF are global. In case of SLA CF,  for each index event Jira will call {{SLACustomFieldIndexer.addDocumentFields()}} method for each CF. 
Mentioned method tries to load SLA values from DB, even in case issue is not related to ServiceDesk, that makes ServiceDesk issue indexing slow due to additional computation. 

h3. Environment
* Jira Core
* Jira ServiceDesk 
* Large number (100+) of _Service Desk SLA_ CF 
{noformat}
select count(*) from customfield where customfieldtypekey like '%sd-sla%';
{noformat}
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Run FullReindex 
# Measure time and monitor DB traffic 

h3. Expected Results
Issue reindex is not affected by SD project 

h3. Actual Results
* Issue reindex time is affected by SD project, increased time 2x
* Large number of SQL request to DB  
 
h3. Notes
* addDocumentFields() loads values from CF from DB, loads it to cache and then check if it needs them
* Taking into account that SD SLA fields are global, Jira is going to call addDocumentFields() for each issue.
* And due to cache flush in {{getValueFromIssue()}} (see JSDSERVER-5685) this has a bigger impact on whole Jira performance.  
* So problem is multiplication of _NumberOfIssues_ * _NumberOfSLA_ * _CostOfSQL_

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Non-optimal computation of SLA values in addDocumentFields() method

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When an agent is part of the same organization as a customer, this agent will be treated as a customer even if they are the assignee of the ticket, and:
 - the SLA won't stop ticking on the condition "Comment:For Customers"
 - the Automation rule that transitions the status from "Waiting for support" to "Waiting for Customer" won't be trigger either

h3. Steps to reproduce
 - Create a Service Desk project
 - Create an agent account (with a Service Desk license) and a customer account in this project
 - Create an organization and add *the agent and the customer* to this organization
 - Configure a Request Type that is associated to a default workflow that contains the "waiting for support" and "waiting for customer" statuses
 - Make sure that the "Time to first response" SLA is configured to stop on the condition "Comment:For Customers"
 - Log into the customer portal as the customer, raise a request and share it with the organization
 - Log into JIRA as the agent, and add a public comment to the ticket

h3. Observed Results

Since the agent is treated as a customer:
 - The Time to First Response SLA does not stop
 - The issue does not transition from the "Waiting for support" to the "Waiting for Customer" status

h3. Expected Results

The agent should not be treated as a customer, and the following behavior should be observed:
 - The Time to First Response SLA stops
 - The issue transitions from the "Waiting for support" to the "Waiting for Customer" status
fields.summary: The condition "Comment:For Customers" in an SLA configuration is not verified when an agent is part of the same organization as the customer

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In versions of Jira Service Desk before 3.10, the "Past Approvals" section was shown in the customer portal, making it clear to customers who had approved the issue in the past.

As of Service Desk 3.10, only the current approval action is shown in the portal. The Jira UI consistently shows the current action, as well as the past actions:

*From Jira's UI:*
!From_JIRAUI.png|thumbnail! 

*From Service Desk Portal:*
!From_CustomerPortal.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Proposed Solution
Provide a toggle for administrators to show the past approvals section in the customer portals. Not all admins may want this functionality, but those who relied on it previously should have the option to use it again.
fields.summary: Display the "Past Approvals" panel in the Customer Portal View of a Request

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a Service Desk user is *granted a Service Desk license and is part of the Service Desk Team role,* this user does not show in the Customers list.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 - Create a user in *⚙ > User Management > Users*
 - Grant this user a *Service Desk license*
 - Create a Service Desk project
 - Go to *Project* *Settings > Users and roles*
 - Grant this user both the *Service Desk Team* and *Service Desk Customer* roles
 !UsersAndRoles1.png|thumbnail!
 - Go to the Customers page of the project
 - Look for the user

h3. Observed Results

The user is not found:
 !Customers1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

The user should be found, since the user can be potentially treated as a customer if:
 - this user is the reporter of a Service Desk request
 - a Service Desk request is shared with this user (via the Request Participants field or the Organizations field)

h3. Notes

Note that if this user is removed from the *Service Desk Team* role (OR if this the *Service Desk license* is removed from this user):
 !UsersAndRoles2.png|thumbnail!

This user can be found in the list of customers:
 !Customers2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: When a Service Desk user is granted a Service Desk license and is part of the Service Desk Team role, this user does not show in the Customers list

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

If a Service Desk is configured with a Knowledge Base space, when a customer creates a request from the Customer portal, Service Desk looks for KB articles which includes words from the request summary.

There can be a situation where a customer tries to raise a new request that is related to a previous request that has been already solved. Since the search doesn't look for past resolved requests, the new request created by the customer might be about an issue that is already known.

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great if Service Desk could also display past resolved requests which include words from the new request as the customer is typing in the summary field, as shown in the screenshot below:
 !Illustration.png|thumbnail! 

This way, it might prevent the customer from filing an un-necessary new request since a similar request has already been resolved in the past.
fields.summary: Include past resolved requests in addition to related KB articles when a customer raises a new request

Our company would like to see functionality added that would allow a team or maybe a editor role added to Jira. Where more that one person can edit and maintain Dashboards are filters.
fields.summary: Add functionality to have multiple users to be able to edit dashboards and filters

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary
 * A participant added to an issue without Request type generates SD notification. Normally, when the request type is missing from an issue in a Service Deks project, no Customer (SD) notifications are sent but, for some reason, adding a participant to the issue will trigger a Customer notification.

h5. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Issue in a service Desk project, from within Jira (not Customer Portal), and do not set any Request Type.
 # Add a participant to the issue created.

h5. Expected Behavior
 * If there is no request type set in the issue, no Customer Notifications are triggered.

h5. Actual Behavior
 * If there is no request type set in the issue, adding a user to the _Participants_ field will trigger customer notifications for this event.

h5. Cause
 * Unknown.

h5. Workaround
 * Do not create issues using the _Create_ button. You can also remove the *Service Desk agents* from the _Create issues_ permission in the Permission scheme of the project, to force them to create issues from the Customer Portal.
 * Follow the KB [Automatically set Customer Request Type When Issue is Created via JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/automatically-set-customer-request-type-when-issue-is-created-via-jira-859463969.html] to configure Jira to automatically set the request type when missed.

h5. Notes:
 * This behavior can only be provoked from within Jira by Agents as Customers do not see the requests from the customer portal when the issue does not have a request type and once the request type has been set, it cannot be removed.
 * This notification leads to other issues, like the one registered in the bug ticket JSDSERVER-4378 JSD not setting requestURL on email notification when request type is empty and the _View request_ link not working: !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Adding a participant to an issue without Request type generates SD notification

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi,

I was wondering does the option to create a linked Issue isn't integrated in the automation section in the Service Desk Server right now like in the [Cloud|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4673]. 

Do you know when the feature will be also included in the Service Desk Server?
fields.summary: Create Linked Issue Automation Rule

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

It is currently not possible to know what type of user added a comment to a Service Desk ticket. The only information that is available is an "INTERNAL" label saying that a comment is internal, but there is no label saying which comment is public, or what type of user added a comment.

h3. Suggested Solution

The suggestion for this feature request is to allow the administrator of a Service Desk project to configure a color system that will be used in comments to determine:
- the source of the comment: Agent, Reporter, Participant, Collaborator
- whether the comment is public or internal
fields.summary: Add a color system to comments in Service Desk tickets to determine if they are public/internal, and what type of users added them

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when a collaborator (for example, a developer) adds an internal comment to a Service Desk ticket, it is not possible to make this comment public. Even if an Agent tries to edit the comment and click on the "Share with customer" button, the comment remains internal.

h3. Suggested Solution

The suggestion for this feature request is to create a button linked to the internal comment that an agent can use to do the following:
# quote an internal comment added by a collaborator
# add some more information to this comment
# share this comment as a new public comment

Currently, to share an internal comment from a collaborator, agents need to copy the comment and paste it in a new comment.
fields.summary: Add the ability for an agent to quote, copy and share an internal comment added by a collaborator

I am looking for an Integration of Jira with Sharepoint. Please suggest a tool for the same?
fields.summary: Need A tool to integrate Jira to Share Point

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
During upgrades, the server.xml and web.xml are wiped clean.

This is getting extremely annoying.  Going forward, because HTTPS is becoming almost required, *everyone* with a Jira setup will need to edit these two files.  Transferring these settings should be considered basic.

A work-around would be to start storing the HTTP and HTTPS settings in the database so that they can be used to later automatically fill in the server.xml and web.xml files.  That would at least cover most basic use cases of the server.xml file and web.xml file.
fields.summary: Transfer server.xml and web.xml settings during upgrade

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Service Desk Queues appear blank when using a Windows based reverse proxy
h3. Environment
 * Jira site is being served up via a windows based reverse proxy, such as IIS

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira Service Desk 3.9.0
 # Setup a Windows Reverse proxy for Jira to use such as the steps in [Integrating JIRA applications with IIS - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/integrating-jira-applications-with-iis-802593039.html]
 # Login as a Jira Admin, that also has application access to JSD (ie you are an Agent)
 # create a new Jira service Desk project (using a sample project with sample data works)
 # Visit that project's queues

h3. Expected Results

Should be able to see those queues
h3. Actual Results

The queue appears blank.
 Also when generating a HAR file we can see HTTP 400 errors (Bad Request) for a pair of resources
{code:java}
https://wwwxxx.example.com/jira/s/829f1542a00a3b316cce28d94773a099-T/-ti4mc6/76002/ca607ec8b51d3f1fd5e6542230b47050/17de11d790a504112fc0738e9f7d40d9/_/download/contextbatch/js/jira.rich.editor,sd.project.queues,jira.view.issue,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devstatus-dialog-resources-ctx,-_super,-jira.view.issue,-jira.global,-sd.project.api,-atl.general,-sd.project.sidebar.content,-sd.project.view,-jira.project.sidebar,-com.atlassian.jira.projects.sidebar.init,-jira.general,-browser-metrics-plugin.contrib/batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&healthcheck-resources=true&is-server-instance=true&is-system-admin=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira.create.linked.issue=true&locale=de-DE&nps-acknowledged=true&nps-not-opted-out=true&richediton=true&sd_operational=true&user-logged-in=true
{code}
AND
{code:java}
https://wwwxxx.example.com/jira/s/22d5ee8ada865cc1e0c56d07dbe3d9de-T/-ti4mc6/76002/ca607ec8b51d3f1fd5e6542230b47050/17de11d790a504112fc0738e9f7d40d9/_/download/contextbatch/css/jira.rich.editor,sd.project.queues,jira.view.issue,com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devstatus-dialog-resources-ctx,-_super,-jira.view.issue,-jira.global,-sd.project.api,-atl.general,-sd.project.sidebar.content,-sd.project.view,-jira.project.sidebar,-com.atlassian.jira.projects.sidebar.init,-jira.general,-browser-metrics-plugin.contrib/batch.css?agile_global_admin_condition=true&healthcheck-resources=true&is-server-instance=true&is-system-admin=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira.create.linked.issue=true&nps-acknowledged=true&nps-not-opted-out=true&richediton=true&sd_operational=true&user-logged-in=true 
{code}
The first request has URL length of 823 characters, while the second that also failed has 812 characters. There were many other shorter URLs that loaded in the page correctly.

You will notice that both requests are calling on the element called 'sd.project.queues'.
h3. Notes

This problem appears to be similar in nature to that of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64917
 While that bug ticket was in regards to the way issue linking in Jira can cause this problem in the same kind of environment, it appears that the way Service Desk is constructing URLs could also encounter this problem in some customers environments.

Luckily, the work-around on that bug ticket can also be applied here:
h4. Cause

Due to the URL length increase, we are reaching the *Windows Path Limit of 260 characters*. This not the IIS URL limit. More details here:
 * [https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa365247(v=vs.85).aspx#maxpath]
 * [https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/723e6bfd-cab7-417b-b487-67f1dcfa524f/uri-path-great-than-260-characters-yeilds-bad-request?forum=netfxnetcom]

h4. Workaround

From the above articles, it is possible to modify the Windows Registry and increase the {{UrlSegmentMaxLength}} value to handle more characters:
 # Backup the Registry
 # With Regedit, browse to {{HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\services\HTTP\Parameters}}
 # Find the value for {{UrlSegmentMaxLength}} (or if it doesn't exist add a DWORD value), and change it to {{00001000}} (this is the hex for 4096)

Powershell alternative:
{code:java}
Set-ItemProperty -Path HKLM:\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\HTTP\Parameters -Name UrlSegmentMaxLength -Value 4096
{code}
After using either method to adjust the registry (Regedit or Powershell), you must restart Windows for the changes to take effect. This will necessitate downtime, please plan a maintenance window accordingly.
fields.summary: Service Desk Queues appear blank and Customer Portal seems broken when using a Windows based reverse proxy

h3. +Environment+
* 65k organizations
* PostgreSQL database

h3. +Steps to reproduce+

- Configure JIRA to use PosgreSQL database
- Create a service desk project
- Create more 65536 than organizations
- Set customer permissions to raise requests to "Customers who are added to the project".
- Go to the Customer page and wait for a while


h3. +Expected Result+

The list of customers should be displayed

h3. +Actual Result+

The search eventually times out and the following error is shown in the UI:
 !Customers_Errors.png|thumbnail! 

h3. +Workaround+

Enable the sd.use.search.by.permissions.disabled dark feature, by following the steps below:
- Navigate to following address: http(s)://<jira_base_url>/secure/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa
- Add the following flag and Enable:
{code}
sd.use.search.by.permissions.disabled
{code}
fields.summary: Service Desk returns an error when searching for Customers within a project that has 65536+ organizations

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Problem:

If a service desk team member enters the customer portal and is searching for a knowledge base article, the default report "Article usage" shows one more view. 

How it should work:

Only if a customer/non license user views an article, the view should count up in the "Article usage" report.
fields.summary: Change default knowledge base report "Article usage"

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When viewing a Confluence KB from the customer portal, the user is not able to retrieve the URL to view the KB in Confluence - the URL will point to the KB article but from the Jira side.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option for the user to view the KB article's URL in Confluence.

h3. Why this is important
If users have access to the KB pages in Confluence, this makes it easier to share the KB article.
fields.summary: Display KB article's Confluence URL in the Customer Portal

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When more than one action that generates a customer notification is performed in a short time period, the customer will receive a single e-mail, notifying them of both actions.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow either the user or the project admin to choose whether notifications will be grouped or not. This could be done by either the customer selecting this option or the admin changing this with a project-wide setting.

h3. Why this is important
Some customers prefer to receive separate e-mails for each event.
fields.summary: Allow users to opt-out of grouped customer notifications

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On the Customer Portal's Forgot Password webpage, the Username field label code is tied to _summary_ instead of to _username_. Please refer to the screenshot below for a better understanding:
 !forgot_password.png|thumbnail!

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install screen reader application, for example [NVDA|https://www.nvaccess.org/].
 # Navigate to Forgot password page on Service Desk customer portal, the URL will be {{<portal URL>/user/forgotpassword}}
 # Press tab to the _Username_ field.

h3. Expected Results

The screen reader will render the field as _Username_.
h3. Actual Results

The screen reader says _Blank_.
h3. Note

This behaviour might differ on different screen readers.
fields.summary: Accessibility - Incorrect field label code on Forgot password page

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hey there,

 

please add the standard ability to show the selected queue name in the browser title or tab.

 

Usually I have 3 Queues open in differrent Tabs:

and their only visible like this:

*_Service Desk_ | _Service Desk_ | _Service Desk_*

 

 

so rather uneffective... I would like to have it more like this:

*_New Tickets_ | _My Tickets_ | _Backlog_*

and would like to visually keep track of differences.

Possibly with issue count as like:

*New Tickets (35) | My Tickets (7) | Backlog (67)*

 

 

I expected this to be already built in since it should be a common user experience.

 

There was already a discussion on Atlassian Community:

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Desk-discussions/Ability-to-show-Queue-name-in-Browser-Title-Working-with/td-p/723412#U733641]

Browser Addons and Marketplace Addons are a no go. ;)

 

Best regards,

Patric
fields.summary: Show selected Queue Name in Tab/Browser Title

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition
We would like to automatically make all comments from one user to be internal comments which cannot be viewed by the customers.

h2. Use Case
# The particular user may be a bot, or some form of automated reply and we want all comments from this user to be internal as default so it does not clog up customer's view.
# The particular user may be a SOP reviewer who performs quality control on responses by Service Desk agents and we want the comments from this user to default to internal only.

h2. Suggested Solution
Implement a feature to default all comments from one user or a group of users to internal or public.
fields.summary: Automatically default comments to internal for one or a group of users

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, in the customer portal, it's not possible to see who changed the status.
This information is only available via email.
It would be great to have this information in the ticket activity.
fields.summary: As a customer I would like to see who changed the status through the customer portal

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In JSD adding a new Request Type, lets call it "Make a Complaint" automatically adds the new Request Type into the Auto-search on Request Forms list, with Search KB set to Yes and Restrict to Articles with Labels unpopulated - thus unrestricted.

This means that if you have already locked down all your existing Request Types you've just punched a massive hole in your Confluence KB and opened up *EVERYTHING* to your customers.

This is a very dangerous default behavior and needs to be fixed please!
fields.summary: Default behavior of Confluence KB search is insecure and opens all KB data up to customers

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: I have configured email alerts from some of our systems that come directly into the JIRA. I would like the ability to add an Organization into the ticket whenever the email is received so that subsequent updates include that organization. For email automation, the THEN component does not allow me to add an Organization.
fields.summary: Allow the addition of an organization based on an incoming email through automation

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Due to a [recent change|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-5488], when exporting issues via CSV, the Customer Organization field is exported with the Organization ID and no longer brings the name of the Organization name. While this format is better for further JIRA imports, it is not human readable and may cause some confusion.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk Project.
# Create a Customer Organization under the project. Ex: organization1
# Raise a ticket on behalf of a member of the Atlassian Organization.
# Go to the Issue Navigator and export the issue to CSV (All Fields).
 !Screen Shot 2018-02-16 at 11.14.34 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The column "Custom Field (Organizations)" displays the organization ID instead
 !Screen Shot 2018-02-16 at 10.57.00 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Desired Results

The column "Custom Field (Organizations)" will display "Atlassian" on the Issue Row.

h3. Workaround
Run this SQL query from the database:
{code}select id, name from AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION;{code}
Then base on the ID to find the NAME.
fields.summary: Export CSV - Ability to export Customer Organizations with their respective name instead of ID

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When a customer logs an issue, we have a workflow where an approval is needed from another user. That user logs in to the portal for the approval, but the "customer request type" is not visible in the detail view. This makes it difficult to see for what that user is giving approval.

It would be usefull to see the see the "customer request type" in the portal on the detail page.
fields.summary: Portal: Customer Request Type should be visible in detail view if the issue

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, the option Database cleaner (From Jira Administration > Global Mail Configuration) includes the *Database Cleaner* that deletes old mails every certain time.

I would like to request the possibility to completely disable the Database cleaner, including a way to know when was the last time it was executed.
fields.summary: Provide an option to fully disable the Database cleaner

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Currently, only the last public comment is being sent from JSD via customer notifications. Some customers would like the option of getting 1 notification email that contains all public comments, instead of only the last public comment.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement a feature to provide option on whether the notification would contain the last public comment, or all public comments on the ticket.

h3. Why This Feature is Important?
In some email clients, the emails does not appear grouped under a single email chain and this leads to a problem where is is difficult for the recipient of the notification to have a full context of the issue.
fields.summary: Include all public comments in customer notification

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h2. Problem
We have a use case whereby:
Let's say we have company A as customer. There we have several contact persons who communicate with us. How is it possible to select Person B as reporter but hiding the request from B (not sending an invitation to the portal)? Example: Person B is only a "user" and should not see any cases related to his problem while Person C is the project manager who should be able to see the issues. For our internal tracking it would be great if we can select Person B as the contact person.

h2. Suggested solution
Separate *Browse Projects* permission into two parts:
# Browse Projects
# Browse Issues

This could be a mechanism which allows customers to raise the request (because they are given access to the project), but unable to see issues (Browse Issues Permission is not given).
fields.summary: Hide customer's request from being seen by the customer

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Ability to clone or copy Service Desk project

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
With the integration of supported versions of Bamboo and a JIRA application, Bamboo can pass JIRA application information relating to:
* Build results
* Deployment statuses

Currently, all build results are appearing in the linked issue regardless of the status and there's no option to show only the successful or failed ones.

h3. Suggestion
An option or filter to show the builds with status

h3. Why is it important
In some scenarios, users just need to be presented with the successful ones. It'd be great to have an option to filter the failed ones out.
fields.summary: Option to show/hide failed Bamboo builds in the Development panel

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
My Service Desk needs to have an ability to have one of the request types to be redirected to an external's company Service Desk (non-Jira)

Let's say, my Service Desk has two request types: 
 # What do you need help with?
 # Other

When users click on 'Other' I need to redirect them to e.g. www.google.com/ServiceDesk

Not having this ability creates a lot of problems for us, and is truly crucial.

Please consider giving it a high priority. 

Thank You!
fields.summary: Customize Customer Portal - allow a request type to be redirected to an external server

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to create customer service project when system language is set to French


h3. Environment
Jira's system language is set to French, Polish, Hungarian


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Installed Jira Software 7.6.0 (or you could just use the Core installer too)
# In System menu (Gear icon -> System -> Edit settings), change system language to French
# Install JSD to this instance (Gear Icon -> Applications -> Try Service Desk button)
# Reindex
# Attempt to create a 'Customer Service' type project 
 !jsdfrenchprojecterror.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
New project is created


h3. Actual Results
# Jira is unable to create this project
# User sees an error in the browser explaining that something went wrong   
!informerror2.png|thumbnail! 
# Jira logs show this error:
*Postgres:*
{code:borderStyle=solid}
2018-02-06 10:20:33,331 http-nio-5760-exec-9 INFO admin 620x874x1 gwvtsl 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/project-templates/1.0/templates [c.a.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager] User 'admin(admin)' updated workflow 'IN: Service Request Fulfilment with Approvals workflow for JIRA Service Desk' at 'Tue Feb 06 10:20:33 CST 2018'
2018-02-06 10:20:33,379 http-nio-5760-exec-9 ERROR admin 620x874x1 gwvtsl 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/project-templates/1.0/templates [c.a.jira.project.ProjectCreateRegistrarImpl] The handler with id com.atlassian.jira.project-templates-plugin:apply-project-template-handler threw an exception while handling a notification about a project being created
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:Status][sequence,27][statuscategory,2][name,Approbation par gestionnaire de modification/évaluation par les pairs][iconurl,/images/icons/status_generic.gif][description,This was auto-generated by JIRA Service Desk during workflow import][id,10118] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.issuestatus (ID, SEQUENCE, pname, DESCRIPTION, ICONURL, STATUSCATEGORY) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (ERROR: value too long for type character varying(60)))
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.createValue(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:299)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.WrappingOfBizDelegator.createValue(WrappingOfBizDelegator.java:172)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.AbstractIssueConstantsManager.createConstant(AbstractIssueConstantsManager.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultStatusManager.createStatus(DefaultStatusManager.java:85)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor527.invoke(Unknown Source)
{code}
*MySQL*:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
2018-01-30 23:02:42,284 http-nio-8080-exec-18 ERROR docmind 1382x904x1 1mj3gh7 41.242.88.32 /rest/project-templates/1.0/templates [c.a.jira.project.ProjectCreateRegistrarImpl] The handler with id com.atlassian.jira.project-templates-plugin:apply-project-template-handler threw an exception while handling a notification about a project being created
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:Status][sequence,23][statuscategory,2][name,Approbation par gestionnaire de modification/évaluation par les pairs][iconurl,/images/icons/status_generic.gif][description,This was auto-generated by JIRA Service Desk during workflow import][id,10016] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO issuestatus (ID, SEQUENCE, pname, DESCRIPTION, ICONURL, STATUSCATEGORY) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (Data truncation: Data too long for column 'pname' at row 1)) 
{code} 

For Polish, it shows this:
The Stack trace is a bit different for *Polski (Polish):*
{code:java}
2018-02-07 17:39:37,597 http-nio-8770-exec-6 ERROR admin 1059x1583x2 sosn62 10.60.2.177 /rest/project-templates/1.0/templates [c.a.jira.project.ProjectCreateRegistrarImpl] The handler with id com.atlassian.jira.project-templates-plugin:apply-project-template-handler threw an exception while handling a notification about a project being created
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:Status][sequence,112][statuscategory,2][name,Recenzja współpracownika/zatwierdzanie przez kierownika zmian][iconurl,/images/icons/status_generic.gif][description,This was auto-generated by JIRA Service Desk during workflow import][id,10119] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.issuestatus (ID, SEQUENCE, pname, DESCRIPTION, ICONURL, STATUSCATEGORY) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (ERROR: value too long for type character varying(60))){code}

h3. Notes
Basically what I think is happening is that the string 'Approbation par gestionnaire de modification/évaluation par les pairs' is too long for the field here (69 characters in length).  I think this is a status name in Jira.  These appear to be limited to a max of 60 characters for both mysql and postgres instances of Jira.   In English I believe this translates to 'Change Manager / Peer Review Approval' (only 37 characters).   It appears that Service Desk is trying to do a literal translation in regards to status values and in this case, that string is too long for French and the constraints of the database itself.

h3.Workaround
# Uninstall the Service Desk from Jira (Gear Icon -> Applications -> select the uninstall option for Service Desk)
# Change the system language back to English
# Reindexed
# Reinstall JSD - Cog Icon -> Applications -> Try Service Desk link
# In my case I had to restart in order to get JSD to load up properly.

At this point I was then able to create this project in Service Desk, however the status will be in English.  While you could convert the system back to French, I do not expect this to change the status names back into a French equivalent.   So this work-around is limited in its scope.
fields.summary: Unable to create IT Service Desk project when system language is set to French, Polish, Hungarian

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently, Service Desk only allows Customers to view Standard issue type level issues. Sub-tasks are hidden from view. However, under different circumstances, an agent may want to grant a customer the ability to view and comment on a sub-task that the agent creates to address the customer's request.
fields.summary: Ability to allow Customers to view Sub-tasks in Service Desk

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently a user must have Administrator permissions to create Automation rules in Jira Service Desk

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a project level permission or allow other users to edit these rules
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like others to be able to edit automation rules

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:

# Install Jira Service Desk and apply its license.
# Configure outgoing mail.
# Create a new user without access to Jira Service Desk (customer).
# Create a new JSD project.
# Have the customer user create a new issue.
# Assign the issue to a Jira Service Desk agent.
# Have the agent add a comment and trigger the transition *Respond to customer*.

h3. Expected Results
Email notifications will be sent to the reporter.

fields.summary: Jira Service Desk may not send email notifications when first installed

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
ServiceDesk method {{RequestAccessUserStrategyManagerImpl}} is called quite frequently as part of page load for ServiceDesk enabled projects. It's called *20* times in a customer portal page load and *75* times on the queue issue view. Under high traffic this generates high load to DB and increase issue load time. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Load the issue and check the number of SQL request to DB
#* Problem exist even if _Approvals_ functionality is not used (_ApproverRequestAccessUserStrategy_) 

h3. Expected Results
Method generates reasonable number of SQL calls: 1-5 per request. 

h3. Actual Results
Method generates high number of SQL calls:
* if user is part of approver role - it makes 40-60 calls to the db per load
* If user can't access the issue - it makes 12 db calls
 
h3. Notes
None

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Approval module generates high volume of DB calls due to unoptimal checks

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We are trying to encourage 'non-development' teams to function following methods promoted by tools such as JIRA. One of our teams who will only work in Service Desk is very excited to use a Kanban board to track Service Desk issues. 
Regretfully I now have to provide that team with a Service Desk and Software seat.

I think it would be nice to allow Service Desk users to fully utilize boards. Many teams like to be able to quickly review the incoming queue via dedicated monitors & TVs.
fields.summary: Allow Service Desk teams to use Kanban/Agile boards without requiring an additional JIRA software seat

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On Jira Service Desk server, pressing the enter key while on a single-line textbox (summary, employee name, etc.) on the customer portal view triggers any datepicker elements currently on the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup an instance of Jira Server v7.5.0 and Service Desk on the same instance, v3.8.1 (though we replicated the same issue on Jira Server v7.2.8, JSD 3.2.8 without problems).
# Create a service desk project
# From Administration > Projects, select your service desk project, then click on "Request types" from the left hand side panel
# Pick any request type and click on "Edit fields"
# Ensure that you have both "Summary" and "Due date" - if the relevant fields aren't there, add them via "Add field" on the top-right hand side
# Move fields around so that the "Due date" fields doesn't immediately follow "Summary" (you can even put it before)
# Access the customer portal view with a user that can create ticket (or configure the application appropriately to allow you to do so)
# Click on the same issue type that you configured.
# On the issue creation form, click on the "Summary" textbox and press enter (whether or not you type anything into the field is irrelevant).

h3. Expected Results
The fields gets set to whatever value was typed into it, and the focus moves to the next field.
Alternatively, nothing happens. In no case should the datepicker open (unless it's the next available field).

h3. Actual Results
The datepicker field (i.e. "Last working day", in this case) opens up, wherever it was set on the page.

h3. Actual Results Screenshots
* Before pressing enter on text field:
!Screen Shot 2018-01-31 at 5.38.54 PM.png|thumbnail! 
* After:
!Screen Shot 2018-01-31 at 5.39.06 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
This appears to have nothing to do with tabindex attibutes. Tabbing through fields works every bit as expected.

h3.Workaround
No workaround for the time being.
fields.summary: Datepicker field gets opens when pressing enter on single-line textbox fields anywhere on the customer portal view

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Goal time is calculated using the start time, due date and working hours in the associated calendar. We iterate over the range of working hours and compute full weeks, full days and partial days (hours).

In this bug, SLAs (remaining and goal time) that range over a Daylight Saving Time (DST) change lose a day. In {{RemainingTimePolicy}} we check if a day is a partial or whole day using the associated working hours calendar. We currently don't account for DST change in this part, so a complete day is counted as partial day. ie. Instead of 1w6d24h we get 1w5d48h, shortened to 1w5d.


*Please note:*
- sla reconstruction won't fix this issue as it happens in our computation at run-time
- this issue will only happen for slas that range over a DST change (clock moving forward or back)
- affects remaining time and goal time


*Steps to reproduce*
1. Change jira timezone in application settings to one that will go through a DST change soon ([managing user preferences|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver/managing-your-user-profile-939937934.html#Managingyouruserprofile-Managingyouruserpreferences])
2. Create a ticket with goal time exceeding day of DST change
fields.summary: SLA improved rendering calculates incorrect value for ranges that include a DST change
